element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: Curvatures provide information about the concavity or convexity of a surface area at a given point.

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: The figures shown were realized with the Fit 2. Degree Polynom (Zevenbergen & Thorne 1987).

element.name: METHOD
element.text: the method to use may be selected from the following: * Fit 2. Degree Polynom (Bauer, Rohdenburg, Bork 1985) * Fit 2. Degree Polynom (Heerdegen & Beran 1982) * Fit 2. Degree Polynom (Zevenbergen & Thorne 1987) * Fit 3. Degree Polynom (Haralick 1983)

element.name: CLASS
element.text: The cells are divided in 9 classes according to the values of horizontal and vertical curvature in them .The meaning of each of these classes and the value asigned to it in this classification layer is as follows: * 0: Vertical Curvature: concave. Horizontal Curvature: concave. * 1: Vertical Curvature: concave. Horizontal Curvature: plane. * 2: Vertical Curvature: concave. Horizontal Curvature: convex * 3: Vertical Curvature: plane. Horizontal Curvature: concave. * 4: Vertical Curvature: plane. Horizontal Curvature: plane. * 5: Vertical Curvature: plane. Horizontal Curvature: convex. * 6: Vertical Curvature: convex. Horizontal Curvature: concave. * 7: Vertical Curvature: convex. Horizontal Curvature: plane. * 8: Vertical Curvature: convex. Horizontal Curvature: convex.

element.name: HORZ
element.text: A horizontal convex curvature represents an area where the flow tends to disperse while horizontal concave curvature represents an area where the flow tends to concentrate since the flow lines converge.

element.name: VERT
element.text: Positive values indicate a convex curvature (areas of flow acceleration), while negative values indicate a concave curvature (areas with a tendency to accumulate water).
